## ConnectionChecker.canConnectWithReason() method

Checks whether the current connection can connect with the target connection, and return an error code if there are problems.

**Signature:**

```typescript
canConnectWithReason(a: Connection | null, b: Connection | null, isDragging: boolean, opt_distance?: number): number;
```

</td><td>

[Connection](./blockly.connection_class.md) \| null


</td><td>

Connection to check compatibility with.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

isDragging


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

True if the connection is being made by dragging a block.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

opt\_distance


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The max allowable distance between the connections for drag checks.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

number

Connection.CAN\_CONNECT if the connection is legal, an error code otherwise.
